abstract: Wang Jianan of China, coached by American Randy Huntington, brings China its first long-jump medal at world track and field championships, finishing third with jump of 8.18 meters behind Greg Rutherford and Fabrice Lapierre; Chinese jumpers also finish fourth and fifth, signal that event long dominated by the West may soon see boost in its global profile.
lead_paragraph: Randy Huntington of Michigan led the Chinese to their first long-jump medal at a global championships on Tuesday, and the top two finishers — British and Australian — are also coached by an American.

headline.main: American Coaches Have a Field Day, but for Other Countries
headline.print_headline: Leap Forward for China; Setbacks for United States

snippet: Randy Huntington of Michigan led the Chinese to their first long-jump medal at a global championships on Tuesday, and the top two finishers — British and Australian — are also coached by an American.
